body: @ijuma Let me know if this seems worthwhile. I couldn't get rid of the lock completely, but at least I was able to reduce its scope. I'm pretty sure we were also missing some cleanup handling: `ConsumerNetworkClient.trySend()` would remove requests from the queue, but the queues were never removed from the map when they become empty.

2. ./jmh-benchmarks/jmh.sh <args>
3.   jmh-benchmarks/jmh.sh <args>

This was motivated by some findbugs warnings about using `==`. Cleaning those up actually led to incorrect behavior by accident. Instead of using `""` for the `NO_DEFAULT_VALUE`, an Object is safer.

As a result of this, I discovered that our test for the output of Connect's validation endpoint for config options without a default value was actually wrong -- it should be returning `null` for the default value, but instead was returning `""` due to using `NO_DEFAULT_VALUE`.
Oh, and @norwood @ijuma @dguy maybe want to review.
@ewencp the incorrect behaviour by accident was in Kafka or a library using Kafka?
